title: Algorithmic Portfolio Management
description: A daily, serverless 10-strategy portfolio that delivers over 100% CAGR over 12+ years with a 3.58 Sharpe, ~50% lower max drawdown than SPY (-17% vs -34%).
intro: Rule #1 of investing is: do not blow up. Many retail algo portfolios quietly fail because they concentrate almost entirely in high-beta tech or semiconductors and assume trends will persist. I made this mistake early on. The core idea here is to run multiple algorithms concurrently so performance is not dependent on one style. As you will see in the results, combining multiple low-correlation algorithms helps reduce drawdowns versus relying on any single model.
execution: I built and iterated on this system over ~4 months. The entire pipeline runs serverlessly on AWS Lambda, with DynamoDB used for state, positions, and daily audit logs. Amazon SES emails me the exact trades and allocations at 3:50 PM ET before market close. I intentionally avoided EC2 because the pricing compared to Lambda functions is worse as it only runs once per day. Each of the 10 algorithms is fixed at a 10% portfolio weight, and the portfolio rotates daily based on each modelâ€™s signal. Individually, several algorithms have meaningfully larger drawdowns and lower Sharpe than the total combined portfolio. The combined system works because the algorithms are not too correlated and can survive the majority of market regimes together.
note: Note: This algorithm is probably overfit. That said, the 12-year historical performance is strong, several of the underlying algorithms have strong community track records, and not all of the algorithms were developed by me. OOS starts in January 2026 and I have under 2 months of paper trading so far. I plan to post another update in a few months, and this stack has been live since February 17, 2026.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 1: Equity Regime + Dip Buyer
strategyOverview.description: The goal of this algorithm is to capture rebounds. It spends most of its time in bonds or cash-like assets, but buys leveraged equity exposure during short-term drawdowns when the market regime is favorable. When markets become extended or risky, it shifts back to defensive positioning like bonds.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 2: Tech Beta with Defensive Fallback
strategyOverview.description: This strategy concentrates in technology and growth leadership when macro and trend conditions are supportive. When conditions worsens, it rotates into bonds or defensive assets. This sleeve captures long-duration tech bull markets while avoiding permanent exposure during regime breakdowns.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 3: Sector Momentum with Crash Overlay
strategyOverview.description: This strategy rotates among equity sectors based on relative strength and momentum, aiming to hold the most favorable sectors. It layers in defensive or hedging logic when markets are bearish.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 4: Volatility State Machine
strategyOverview.description: This is an active volatility trading engine, treating volatility as a regime that transitions between calm, building stress, and crisis states. In calm markets, it harvests carry or stays risk-on. As stress rises, it progressively rotates into convex volatility exposure and defensive assets. During crisis regimes, it prioritizes capital preservation.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 5: Overbought Volatility Hedge Ladder
strategyOverview.description: This is a pure defensive overlay designed to provide systematic crash insurance. It does not attempt to trade volatility cycles for profit. Instead, it monitors equity overextension and progressively builds convex volatility hedges as markets become volatile.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 6: Cross-Asset Trend Risk Switch
strategyOverview.description: This strategy uses bond trends as a signal for overall market risk. When bonds suggest markets are stable and liquidity is healthy, it allows more stock exposure. When bond trends point to tightening or rising stress, it shifts toward safer, defensive assets.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 7: Emerging Markets Directional Trader (Tactical)
strategyOverview.description: This strategy trades emerging markets directionally using trend filters combined with short-term oversold and overbought signals. It is designed to capture violent EM rebounds and cyclical surges, accepting higher drawdowns in exchange for convex upside.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 8: Emerging Markets Trend Follower (Variant)
strategyOverview.description: This is a close variant of the EM directional strategy, with more emphasis on staying aligned with sustained EM trends and less on tactical timing. In practice, I intentionally run two similar EM models with slightly different indicators.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 9: Rates Trend with Convex Hedge
strategyOverview.description: This strategy allocates between growth equities and bond duration based on trend and regime signals. It benefits from falling-rate environments and de-risks when rate trends reverse. It also applies defensive hedges when equity risk rises, providing cross-asset diversification.

strategyOverview.title: Strat 10: Gold Trend with Blow-Off Reversal
strategyOverview.description: This strategy trades gold as a macro hedge and trend asset. It rides sustained trends in gold during inflationary or risk-off regimes and attempts contrarian positioning during parabolic moves. This is a convex satellite rather than a core return engine.
